function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The webpage displays a checkout form within an e-commerce site, specifically for the purchase of Galaxy S10 5G and Galaxy S10+ phones. The form is divided into sections for customer information, address details, and payment options. The customer information section is partially filled with a first name, last name, and email, while the address details require inputs for country, street address, city, state, and zip code. The form also presents payment options through a dropdown menu for selecting Invoice, Credit Card, or PayPal, and there's a submit button. Additionally, the cart summary lists two items with their respective prices and a total cost.","new_testing_goal":"Correctly fill in the address details, choose a payment method, and submit the order successfully.","explanation":"Continue with filling out the checkout form by entering the street address next. This action follows the goal of testing the form's input and submission functionalities fully, including form validation for required fields and processing the selected payment method.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rt:","keys":"123 Galaxy Way"}}

messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.
Here are some examples how the 'emulate_interaction' function should be used.
Please test my website: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description": "The start page of a web site with multiple calculators for different purposes. There are buttons to navigate to the differet calculators and a button to switch the language of the web site. The current language is English.", "new_testing_goal": "Test the calculator for calculating the area of a circle in multiple languages.", "explanation": "First navigate to the calculator for the area of a circle. Then input a radius and calculate the area. Switch the language of the web site and repeat the process.", "interaction": {"interaction_type": "click", "element_id": "btn-area-circle"}}

messages.content: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases. Here is the filtered HTML source code of the web application: 'omitted'.

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The checkout page of an e-commerce website, displaying a summary of the cart items for purchase which include Galaxy S10 5G and Galaxy S10+. Each item in the cart has its price listed and there's a total cost displayed at the bottom. The page also includes a form for customer information, address details, and payment options. The form fields are blank, awaiting user input.","new_testing_goal":"Complete the checkout process by filling in customer, address details, and selecting a payment method before submitting the order.","explanation":"Begin the checkout process by filling in the customer information starting with the First Name field. This will test the form functionality and ensure that all required fields can be filled.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rp:","keys":"John"}}

messages.name: emulate_interaction
messages.content: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is currently on the checkout page of an e-commerce platform showcasing the Galaxy S10 series. The user has already started the checkout process, with the customer's first name ('John') filled in. The checkout page is divided into three sections: customer information, address details, and payment options. The customer information section has fields for the first name, which is filled, and empty fields for the last name, email, country, street address, city, state, and zip code. There's also a dropdown for payment (Invoice, Credit Card, PayPal) and a submit button.","new_testing_goal":"Complete filling in the checkout details to test form input functionality and submission.","explanation":"Continue to fill in the remaining customer information fields starting with the 'Last Name' and then the 'E-mail' to simulate a typical user completing checkout forms. This will help in testing the form's input fields for proper functionality.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rq:","keys":"Doe"}}

messages.name: emulate_interaction
messages.content: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is on the checkout page displaying a form divided into customer information, address details, and payment options. The 'Customer' section includes filled 'First Name' and 'Last Name', with 'E-Mail' and other fields empty. The 'Address' section has fields for 'Country', 'Street Address', 'City', 'State', and 'Zip Code', all empty. The 'Payment' section includes a dropdown for selecting 'Invoice', 'Credit Card', or 'PayPal'. A 'Submit' button is available for finalizing the checkout process.","new_testing_goal":"Fill in the email address, complete the address details, select a payment method, and submit the order.","explanation":"Fill in the 'E-Mail' field with a fictional email address, then proceed to fill in the 'Country' and further address details. This will test the form's input functionality further. Then, select a payment method and finally click the 'Submit' button to test the order submission process.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rr:","keys":"john.doe@example.com"}}

messages.name: emulate_interaction

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is on the checkout page displaying a detailed form for finalizing a purchase. There are sections for customer information (with fields filled for first name, last name, and email), address details (with fields for country, street address, city, state, zip code - all empty), and payment options (with options for invoice, credit card, PayPal - none selected). Additionally, there is a 'Submit' button for completing the checkout process. The shopping cart summary lists two items: Galaxy S10 5G and Galaxy S10+, showing quantities and prices, alongside a total cost.","new_testing_goal":"Test completeness and validation of the checkout process, including edge cases like submitting with incomplete address details or selecting each payment method.","explanation":"First, attempt to submit the form without filling in the address details to test form validation. Then, fill in the address details, select each payment option one by one, and attempt submissions to test the handling of different payment methods and the form's overall completion and validation.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":ri:"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website displays a checkout page with a cart summary showing two items: Galaxy S10 5G and Galaxy S10+, quantities, prices, and a total cost. A form below requires customer information (with 'First Name', 'Last Name', and 'E-Mail' already filled in), address details (all fields empty), and payment options (not yet selected). There's a 'Submit' button at the bottom. Error messages indicate missing 'Country', 'City', 'State', 'Street Address', and 'Zip Code'.","new_testing_goal":"Successfully submit the checkout form by correctly filling in all required fields, including address details, and selecting a payment method.","explanation":"Start by filling in the 'Country' field to correct one of the form errors. This step will progress towards fixing the form validation issues and allow testing the form's responsiveness to correct input.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rs:","keys":"USA"}}

The user provided the following end instructions: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases.
Pursue your self-assigned sub-goal or assign a new one: Successfully submit the checkout form by correctly filling in all required fields, including address details, and selecting a payment method..

Previously executed interactions by goal: {"Explore the functionality of the shopping cart by adding multiple items to it and checking if the cart updates correctly.": 3, "Test the functionality of increasing and decreasing item quantities in the cart, and then attempt to proceed to checkout.": 1, "Test the checkout process after adjusting the quantities of items in the cart.": 1, "Proceed to checkout after adjusting item quantities and test the checkout process.": 1, "Complete the checkout process by filling in customer, address details, and selecting a payment method before submitting the order.": 1, "Complete filling in the checkout details to test form input functionality and submission.": 1, "Fill in the email address, complete the address details, select a payment method, and submit the order.": 1, "Test completeness and validation of the checkout process, including edge cases like submitting with incomplete address details or selecting each payment method.": 1, "Successfully submit the checkout form by correctly filling in all required fields, including address details, and selecting a payment method.": 1}.

Start by describing the website supplied by the function call. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then you may formulate a high level sub-goal to the user's instructions, that should be persued with the next couple of interactions. You should formulate a new sub-goal if the current one has been completed or seems to be unattainable. Give an action plan that explains how the goal should be reached. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.

Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: :ri:, :r1:, :r2:, :rj:, :rk:, :rl:, :rm:, :rn:, :ro:. Only use the send_keys action with writable elements. The writable elements have the following ids: :rp:, :rq:, :rr:, :rs:, :rt:, :ru:, :rv:, :r10:. Only use the clear action with clearable elements. The clearable elements have the following ids: :rp:, :rq:, :rr:, :rs:.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

new_testing_goal.description: Assigns a new high level sub-goal that shall be followed in order to complete the users instructions. This goal should take multiple user interactions to complete. The assistant shall try to complete this goal in the next couple of interactions and then assign a new one.

explanation.description: An action plan that explains how the goal should be reached.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

keys.description: the keys to be sent to the input element

anyOf.description: sends keystrokes to an html element

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

anyOf.description: resets the contents of an html element
